snippet: Dennis L. Rader, who called himself “B.T.K.,” said in a letter from prison that he is cooperating with a book about the 10 people he killed to help the victims’ families monetarily.
abstract: Serial killer Dennis L Rader says in letter from prison that he is cooperating with book about 10 people he killed in the Wichita, Kan, area; says his intention is to help victims' families monetarily and to advance understanding of criminal mind for investigators and criminologists.
lead_paragraph: Dennis L. Rader, who called himself “B.T.K.,” said in a letter from prison that he is cooperating with a book about the 10 people he killed to help the victims’ families monetarily.

headline.main: B.T.K. Killer to Write Book About Murders
headline.print_headline: B.T.K. Killer to Write Book About Murders
